{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is on treatment with four drugs: indinavir, zidovudine, lamivudine, and ketoconazole. The adverse effects mentioned are nephrolithiasis, hyperlipidemia, central obesity, hyperglycemia, and insulin resistance. Lamivudine is an antiretroviral medication used to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS. It is not known to cause the adverse effects listed. Zidovudine is also an antiretroviral medication, and it is not associated with these side effects either. Ketoconazole is an antifungal medication, and it does not typically cause these adverse effects. Indinavir, on the other hand, is a protease inhibitor used in the treatment of HIV. It is known to cause nephrolithiasis and metabolic abnormalities such as hyperlipidemia, central obesity, hyperglycemia, and insulin resistance.", "answer_choice": "B. Indinavir"}
